result.execSummary:
The defendant Damon C Patton was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Concurrent to any other sentence

Defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after serving 3 years of the sentence.

superMiscConds.notes: Provide a DNA sample. Pay all court costs, fees and surcharges including DNA surcharge and any victim surcharges by the end of supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. All applicable fees of supervision, this can be based on a budget plan. Court ordered all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the DOC's from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a conditon of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums. Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. Court advised defendant that he may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Obtain/maintain ful-time employment/education/vocation.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

records.addlTxt: Original Transcript (15 pages) SENTENCING commencing JULY 29, 2015 received and filed.

Defendant Damon C Patton in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Damon C Patton in custody.  Thomas L. Potter for Irene Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  

As to Count 1:
The Court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM TERM OF IMPRISONMENT of  10 YEARS with 370 days credit CONCURRENT to any other sentence; the INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT in the Wisconsin State Prison System is 5 YEARS; the MAXIMUM TERM OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 5 YEARS.

Court finds defendant IS eligible for the Challenge Incarceration program and the WI Substance Abuse program after serving 3 YEARS of the sentence.  

Conditions of Extended Supervision:
- AODA assessment and cooperate with any programs deemed necessary by the probation department.
- Absolute/maintain sobriety, no alcohol, no drugs.
- No possession/consumption/selling/distribution of illegal drugs/alcohol.
- Random urine screens as deemed appropriate.
- Provide a DNA sample.
- Obtain/maintain fulltime employment/education/vocation.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.
- Follow all rules of supervision and follow through with any other treatment deemed necessary by the department.

Court ordered the defendant pay all of the following by the end of supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment:
Restitution in the amount of $2,414.00 payable to Robert G.; 
All court costs, fees, and surcharges (including DNA and any victim surcharges); 
All applicable fees of supervision, this can be based on abudget plan;
-  Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment.

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm. 
Court advised defendant of his right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised defendant that he/she may not vote until his civil rights have been restored.  

Filed:  
Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence 
Victim Impact Statement    
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Ineligible Voting Notice & Acknowledgement
letter from the defendant received and filed.
Victim impact statement received and filed.

Defendant Damon C Patton in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Damon C Patton in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial, however parties would like to proceed with a plea hearing instead.  Jury trial date of 06/24/2015 is vacated.
Pursuant to plea negotiations, Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed and read in for the purpose of sentencing.  As to Count 1:
  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Information and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.  
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.  Case is adjourned for sentencing in Branch 22.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for July 29, 2015 at 08:30 am.
May 12, 2015 @8:30A in Br 22, CH Rm 608 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.
May 12, 2015 @ 8:30A in BR 22, CH Rm 608 of the Circuit Court of Milwaukee County.

Defendant Damon C Patton in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Damon C Patton in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case in court for Final pre-trial, parties request an adjourned final pre-trial and jury trial dates.  March 30, 2015 jury trial date is vacated.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.
  Final pre-trial scheduled for May 12, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for June 24, 2015 at 09:00 am.
For reasons stated on the record, the Court orders $500 cash bail.  All other previously set conditions of bail remain.

Defendant Damon C Patton in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Damon C Patton in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for final pre-trial.  Attorney Mary Guimont has taken over as counsel.  Previously scheduled jury trial date does not work for her schedule, new date is chosen.  Case remains calendared in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for March 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for March 30, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Richard J. Johnson in court, defendant Damon C Patton not in court, in custody.  Irene Elizabeth Parthum appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for jury trial.  For reasons stated on the record, the Court GRANTS the defense motion to adjourn the jury trial in Branch 22.  Final pre-trial scheduled for December 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 2, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Attorney Richard J. Johnson in court, defendant Damon C Patton not in court, in custody at Waukesha County Jail.  Thomas L. Potter appeared for the State of Wisconsin on behalf of Irene Parthum.  Jury trial scheduled for 10-20-2014 at 09:00 am.
Original Transcript PRELIMINARY HEARING (35 pages) commencing JULY 8, 2014 received and filed.

Defendant Damon C Patton in court with attorney Louis Epps for Richard J. Johnson.  Defendant Damon C Patton in custody.  Janet C. Protasiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin. 
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Chuck Fletcher-Greenfield Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 29, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Robert G., Tommy R. and "Coins & Quilts".

Defendant Damon C Patton in court with attorney Stephen A Sargent.  Defendant Damon C Patton in custody.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Witkowiak, Branch 22.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  
DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
